description: Feline coronavirus (FCoV; family Coronaviridae, genus Alphacoronavirus) is an enveloped, single-stranded, positive-sense RNA virus. FCoV exists as two different biotypes: feline enteric coronavirus (FECV) and feline infectious peritonitis virus (FIPV). The former causes mild enteritis (usually subclinical infection), and the latter causes the highly lethal systemic disease FIP.
name: Feline Coronavirus Antibodies and Antigens
